intro: Oonopsis wardii var. condensata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically has thick, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This variety is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
